Frequently Asked Questions

Does all the money get paid back if members opt-out?

Yes. When members opt-out within the time frame given in the regulations, any money paid to the Trustee account will be returned to the employer. The employer is responsible for repaying any employee deductions made back to the employee via payroll. This repayment to the employee must be made as soon as possible however repayment from the Trustee account to the employer may take a little longer to arrange.

What happens to members that opt-out?

All activity that the member makes with regards to automatic enrolment is held within the member record, which can be accessed via the employer portal and/or is stored within our automatic enrolment system. Details of this will be sent to the employer upon successful application to the NOW: Pensions trust.

If an employer manages the automatic enrolment of their workers then the opt in data must be logged and stored by the employer. Opt out details for each member is passed to the employer via the return file which provides the date that the contributions need to cease in the form of a members opt out date.

The employer must comply with data privacy regulations with regards to retention periods for keeping member data.

What is Auto Enrolment?

Auto Enrolment is a legal requirement for all employers to provide a pension that meets minimum standards by 2018 (it is phased in for different sizes of employers from 2012).

All employees over age 22 and below State Pension Age, who work or ordinarily work in the UK, must be enrolled into a pension scheme as long as they earn over a certain amount per week or month.
